cards.name: King Arthur
cards.bio: The legendary British leader who, according to medieval histories and romances, led the defense of Britain against Saxon invaders.

cards.name: Queen Elizabeth I
cards.bio: The Virgin Queen, Elizabeth was a ruler who oversaw the English Renaissance and the defeat of the Spanish Armada.

cards.name: Emperor Nero
cards.bio: The last Roman emperor of the Julio-Claudian dynasty, known for his artistic endeavors and infamous for his tyranny.

cards.name: Pharaoh Cleopatra
cards.bio: The last active ruler of the Ptolemaic Kingdom of Egypt, known for her relationships with Roman rulers Julius Caesar and Mark Antony.

cards.name: Tsar Ivan the Terrible
cards.bio: The first Tsar of All Russia, Ivan IV was known for his ruthless tactics and transformation of Russia into a multiethnic and multicontinental state.

cards.name: Empress Wu Zetian
cards.bio: The only female emperor in the history of China, Wu Zetian founded the Zhou dynasty and was known for her effective and controversial rule.

cards.name: King Louis XIV
cards.bio: Louis the Great or the Sun King, he was the Animal Monarchs of the House of Bourbon who reigned as King of France and is known for his long and powerful reign.

cards.name: Sultan Suleiman the Magnificent
cards.bio: The tenth and longest-reigning Sultan of the Ottoman Empire, Suleiman was known for his military conquests and cultural achievements.

cards.name: Shah Jahan
cards.bio: The fifth Mughal emperor, who reigned from 1628 to 1658, Shah Jahan is best known for commissioning the Taj Mahal, a mausoleum for his favorite wife.

cards.name: Queen Victoria
cards.bio: The Queen of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland, Victoria presided over a time of industrial expansion, cultural changes, and the British Empire.

cards.name: The Immortal Emperor
cards.bio: A timeless ruler whose reign spans eons, commanding vast armies and wielding ancient, mystical powers.
